headline: A Global Market Based on Gold Bars Shudders on Tariff Threat
summary: (Bloomberg) -- The global gold market relies on a network of banks, refineries and couriers that can fly bullion between key trading hubs at a moment’s notice in pursuit of the highest prices. On Friday, a shock US ruling suggesting that the metal would be subject to tariffs plunged that system into chaos.Most Read from BloombergNew York Warns of $34 Billion Budget Hole, Biggest Since 2009 CrisisSunseeking Germans Face Swiss Backlash Over Alpine Holiday CongestionThree Deaths Reported as NYC Leg
